definition[0]: a share issue in which offers above a particular price are invited for the shares
example[0]: Some of the early privatization issues such as Britoil and Cable and Wireless were tender issues.
definition[1]: in Britain, an ISSUE of TREASURY BILLs that is made every week by the Bank of England
example[1]: Discount houses underwrite the weekly tender issue of Treasury bills by bidding competitively for those not sold.
